title: 'I'm really scared about him not being here': Charlotte Church on her father's terminal illness
text:
Any account of how a family copes when one of them has a terminal illness inevitably touches on our own deepest insecurities, but there is a particular poignancy in Charlotte Church’s brave and candid new documentary about facing up to the death of her adoptive father James, diagnosed with AL amyloidosis, a rare blood disorder, and given six months to live.

Despite being widely billed in advance as chronicling the singer’s attempt to heal her volatile relationship with her mother, Maria, who guided the early Voice of an Angel years of her career, the real subject of the film broadcast tonight turns out instead to be an unflinching and very personal examination of grief at imminent loss.
